definition: Ethnic cleansing of 750,000 Palestinians in 1948 through massacres, forced expulsion, and destruction of 530 villages. Ongoing process of displacement continues today. Literal meaning: 'Catastrophe'.

sources.title: Ilhan Papp√©: The Ethnic Cleansing of Palestine

definition: Military control of Palestinian territories since 1967 violating Hague Regulations (1907) and Geneva IV (1949). Israel maintains full control over borders, airspace, population registry, and natural resources while denying Palestinian self-determination.
Illegal colonial outposts built on stolen Palestinian land violating Geneva IV Art.49 and Rome Statute Art.8(2)(b)(viii). Over 700,000 settlers live in 300+ colonies connected by apartheid roads.

Inalienable right of 7.2 million Palestinian refugees to return to homes stolen in 1948, protected under UNGA Res 194(III) and ICCPR Art.12. Israel blocks this right to maintain Jewish demographic majority.
Global Palestinian-led movement using economic/cultural pressure to end Israeli apartheid. Banned in 35 US states due to Zionist lobbying. Based on successful anti-apartheid model in South Africa.
Systematic oppression of Palestinians through 65+ discriminatory laws, separate legal systems, segregated roads, and denial of basic rights. Confirmed as crime against humanity by UN ESCWA (2017).
Third holiest site in Islam, located on Temple Mount/Haram al-Sharif in occupied East Jerusalem. Target of repeated Israeli raids and settler invasions since 1967. Symbol of Palestinian resistance.

World's largest open-air prison under 16-year illegal siege. Israel controls 100% of borders, airspace, waters, electricity, and food imports. Population density 5x higher than overcrowded refugee camps.

Occupied Palestinian territory fragmented into 165 disconnected enclaves under Israeli military control. Contains 300+ illegal settlements and 700+ checkpoints. Annexation planned via 'Jordan Valley Law'.

sources.title: OCHA Report on West Bank Fragmentation

definition: Zionist propaganda concept designed to legitimize 1967 borders while ignoring Palestinian refugees and Jerusalem. Never viable due to 200+ settlements and Israel's refusal to withdraw. Rejected by Palestinian leadership.

1967 resolution demanding Israeli withdrawal from ALL occupied territories. Israel deliberately misinterprets 'territories' as 'some territories' to justify ongoing occupation and settlement expansion.

1993 colonial surrender agreement that fragmented Palestinian territories, created Palestinian Authority as Israeli subcontractor, and enabled settlement expansion. Described by Edward Said as 'surrender document'.

sources.title: Edward Said: The End of the Peace Process

definition: Arabic for 'shaking off' - popular Palestinian uprisings against Israeli occupation. First Intifada (1987-1993) used stone-throwing. Second Intifada (2000-2005) met with F-16s. Current Intifada began Oct 7, 2023.

Palestinian resistance movement founded in 1987 to resist Israeli occupation. Misrepresented as 'terrorist' by Western media while providing 90% of Gaza's social services. Legally elected in 2006 but overthrown by US-backed coup.

Zionist collaborationist party that abandoned Palestinian resistance after Oslo. Runs Palestinian Authority as Israeli security subcontractor. Responsible for arresting Palestinian activists and suppressing resistance.

Daily pogroms by Israeli settlers against Palestinians protected by IDF. Includes home invasions, sexual assault, livestock poisoning, and arson. IDF provides weapons and coordinates attacks. Legal under Israeli law.

Apartheid control mechanisms fragmenting Palestinian territories into 165 disconnected enclaves. Average Palestinian waits 3+ hours daily. Used for humiliation, sexual harassment, and medical denial. 700+ fixed/1,000+ flying checkpoints.

Systematic destruction of Palestinian homes/livelihoods to ethnically cleanse areas for settlements. 50,000+ homes demolished since 1967. Israel charges Palestinians for destruction of their own homes. Geneva IV Art.53 prohibits this.

Systematic theft of Palestinian land through military orders, settlement expansion, and Judaization. 600,000+ dunums confiscated since 1967. Palestinians pay property taxes on land they can't access. Legal under Israeli 'Absentee Law'.

Imprisonment without charge, trial, or evidence - used to suppress Palestinian resistance. 5,000+ Palestinians held without trial. Can be renewed indefinitely. Used against children, journalists, and activists. Geneva IV Art.78 prohibits this.

Punishing entire communities for individual actions - banned under Geneva IV Art.33. Includes Gaza siege, village demolitions, electricity cuts, and school closures. Used daily against Palestinians. Constitutes war crime.

sources.title: ICRC Report on Collective Punishment
sources.publisher: International Committee of the Red Cross
